intro: Campylanthus glaber subsp. spathulatus, commonly known as the broad-leaf campylanthus, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
